title: Riot: Anything on Talon?
body: Hey Riot, are you planning on any spell changes or buffs/nerfs on Talon? It seems he hasnt honestly been touched or spoken about since his silence was removed. Im just curious if there is any plans on him in the near future.

replies.body:
Nothing planned for the short term for Talon specifically, though we are looking to put out a new item targeted at AD assassins in particular early next year that he'll probably like. 

Whenever we do some work on assassins as a class (potentially sometime next year) Talon's definitely one of the ones we'd want to look at, given he lacks clear enough distinction from other champions, could do with a more satisfying passive, has a cool theme that's not being taken full advantage of and has a really reliable combat pattern with limited counterplay to it.
So I assume you're going to move his Passive to one of his abilities, just like how you do to other champs{{champion:21}} {{champion:72}} ?

I'd imagine we'd either remove the passive outright and put something completely new in its place or, if sticking with something that rewards auto attacking, go for something with both more gameplay and more impact to it, siphoning power from elsewhere if needed.

It just really doesnßt deliver a meaningfull assassin-fantasy gamplay wise but instead takes away a lot of counterplay usually, as autoattacking is just an on/off pattern you can´t really play around that much.

Just out of curiosity, why is it so easy to buff zed's numbers but not talon's? Both seem to be pretty weak due to item changes. What is the logic behind the constant amount of tweaks zed receives vs the complete lack of attention talon's kit gets? Just curious, because they both have very similar builds and play-styles.

Most likely the amount of counterplay each Assassin has, respectively. Zed has tons more counterplay against Talon in terms of executing their burst. With Zed, he has to ult you, giving you about a second to react and realize what he is going to do, then after that ult he has to apply damage to you, typically at point blank and make it enough that he can finish you with the Ult proc or a few ticks of damage after the ult pops, all in all something that takes 3-5 seconds, which is plenty of time to react and act against him to stop him from assassinating you. 

Talon, on the other hand, E's to you once in range then hits W-Q-R-R for his burst in something that takes less then a second. Hardly any time to react or stop him from doing so other then hitting Zhonya's.
